required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Outcomes in Spontaneous and ART Twin Pregnancies
clinical_study.official_title: Maternal and Perinatal Outcomes in Spontaneous Twins Versus Twins Conceived by Ovulation Induction and Assisted Reproductive Techniques: A Cross Section Study Within One Year

brief_summary.textblock:
During the last decades, assisted reproductive technique has been transformed from a miracle to real and has become widely used for treatment human infertility.
this was associated with increased the rate of twin pregnancies

detailed_description.textblock:
Twin pregnancies are associated with an increased risk of maternal mortality & morbidity and an increase in the incidence of neonatal morbidity and mortality compared to singleton pregnancy.
The heterogeneous results reported so far can also depend on differences in the studied populations and/or in the management approach to twin pregnancy, variability in data regarding neonatal and maternal outcomes.
Evidence on pregnancy outcomes of twins conceived by artificial reproductive technology (ART) compared with those naturally conceived (NC) is conflicting, A 2004 systematic review and a large 2008 study both were praised that in cases of twin pregnancy after assisted conception the perinatal mortality is significantly lower, when compared with those spontaneously conceived .

primary_outcome.measure: Maternal diabetes using glucose tolerance test
primary_outcome.description: The diagnosis of GDM was based a fasting plasma glucose level of ≥5.6 mmol/L with 2 h plasma glucose level of ≥7.8 mmol/L

primary_outcome.measure: Hypertension during pregnancy and preeclampsia diagnosed using ACOG guideline a) weight in kilogram b) Apgar score in first and 10th minutes c)Admission to neonatal intensive acre unit measured in days
primary_outcome.description: Systolic and diastolic blood pressure equal or more than140/90 mm Hg measured on two or more occasions after 20 weeks of gestation in previously normotensive women, with or without proteinuria (proteinuria of >100 mg/dL by urine analysis, or >300 mg/24 h)
Bleeding from genital tract of 500 mL or more vaginally
categorized as extreme low birth weight (LBW) for <1000 g, very LBW for 1000-1500 g, LBW for 1500-2500 g, and normal birth weight for >2500 g

primary_outcome.measure: Neonatal Apgar(Appearance, Pulse, Grimace, Activity, and Respiration) score
primary_outcome.time_frame: first and fifth minute of life
primary_outcome.description: Apgar scores includes 10 sores , 2 for each . The Apgar score was classified as severely depressed <0-3>, moderately depressed<4-6> and excellent condition<7-10>

primary_outcome.measure: Admission to neonatal care unit in days

study_pop.textblock:
Twin delivery was identified when coming to outpatient clinic & labour ward into two groups, first group iatrogenic conceived twins (either ART, or medical ovulation induction mainly clomiphene citrate and gonadotrophins).The second group is a twin pregnancy who conceived naturally .
Demographic characters, maternal and neonatal outcomes were compared in both groups

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Twin delivered >24-week gestational age
- weight ≥ 500g
- Diachronic diamniotic twins.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Intrauterine fetal deaths
- Higher-order multiple pregnancies
- Deliveries complicated by early vanishing fetuses
- Twin pregnancies reduced to singleton
- Triple pregnancy reduced to twin.

overall_official.affiliation: Hawler Medical University, College of Medicine
